title: 86/213/EEC: Commission Decision of 30 May 1986 authorizing import into Portugal at a reduced levy of certain quantities of raw sugar originating in third countries (Only the Portuguese text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION  DECISION
of 30 May 1986
authorizing import into Portugal at a reduced levy of certain quantities of raw sugar originating in third countries
(Only the Portuguese text is authentic)
(86/213/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Portugal is hereby authorized to import from third countries during the period from 1 March to 30 June 1986 a quantity of raw sugar equivalent to 75 000 tonnes of white sugar, at the reduced levy determined in accordance with Article 1 of Regulation (EEC) No 600/86.

1. The import licences for the raw sugar referred to in Article 1 shall be valid from the date of issue until 30 June 1986.
2. The application for the licence referred to in paragraph 1 must be made to the competent authority in Portugal and must be accompanied by a declaration from a refiner in which he undertakes to refine the quantity of raw sugar concerned in Portugal within six months following the month in which the customs import formalities take place.
If the sugar in question is not refined within the prescribed time limit, the importer must pay an amount equal to the difference between the threshold price and the intervention price for raw sugar applicable on the day of acceptance of the import declaration concerned.
3. The application for the import licence and the licence itself shall include in box 12 the following:
'import of raw sugar at reduced levy in accordance with Decision 86/213/EEC'.
4. The rate of deposit applicable to the licence referred to in paragraph 1 is hereby fixed at 0,25 ECU for each 100 kilogrammes of sugar net.

For the application of Article 1 and within the stated limits, the quantities of sugar to be exported outside the Community by Portugal in conformity with Article 4 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 579/86 are to be considered on request as being sugar imported from third countries. The quantities of this sugar declared on import with the application of the reduced levy in force on the day of acceptance of the import declaration are to be deducted from the quantities for export outside the Community under Article 4 (1) of the same Regulation.
This Decision is addressed to the Portuguese Republic.
